ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, but not to students not interested in public service.
I would certainly recommend it. It was a great foundational course in understanding the true complexities and difficulties in creating counter-terrorism policies.
Definitely recommend. There is a substantial amount of reading but most of it is easy to grasp and is to the point.

I would definitely recommend the course to anyone with an interest in the challenges terrorism and especially counterterrorism pose for democratic societies. The Professor's hands on experience in the field and his dual academic and political/professional perspectives makes the course a unique opportunity to understand the complexities of the topic. A very relevant course for anyone with a background in political science.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Broader knowledge of CT helps me understand the bigger picture in U.S. policy decisions.
This course advanced my knowledge in how to prepare proper memorandums as well as focusing certain issues which often are muddled with each other.
The topic was new for me but the course has provided a very useful broad insight into the field and a sound basis for choosing which aspects I may wish to look further into.
